dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Concerning property

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:11148847

Date of creation: 1809-01-23

Petition location: New Bedford

Legislator, committee, or address that the petition was sent to: Several names from a committee

Selected signatures:

  1. Ebenezer Perry

Actions taken on dates: 1809-02-06,1809-02-08,1809-06-08,1810-02-01,1810-02-02

Legislative action: Received in the House on February 6, 1809 and committed to report and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on February 8, 1809 and concurred and received in the Senate on June 8, 1809 and committed to report and sent for concurrence and received in the House on June 8, 1809 and concurred and received in the Senate on February 1, 1810 and committed to report and sent for concurrence and received in the House on February 2, 1810 and concurred

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, committed, sent, received, concurred, received, committed, sent, received, concurred, received, committed, sent, received, concurred

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: Administrator upon the estate of Zebedee McDaniel

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional non-petition or unrelated documents available at archive: additional documents available

Additional archivist notes: Zebedee McDaniel, Walter Spooner, daughter, wife of your petitioner, Bristol county, heirs, probate, house, assistance, compensation, property, Jirch Perry, son of your petitioner, minor, precluded from legal execution of his will, with certification from inhabitants of New Bedford, William Rotch, William Rotch Jr., Samuel Rodman, Abraham Russell, Seth Russell, Edward Pope, Joseph Ricketson, John Williams, Silas Kempton

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Senate Unpassed 1810, Docket 4060
